lines.value: jovan milenko grcic cerevic srem 15 november 1846-fruska gora beocin monastery 25 may 1875 was first and foremost a serbian poet and then a prose writer
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: the freshness of his lyrical poetry places him in the succession of branko radicevic and he is also noted for his power of natural description
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: jovan grcic milenko translated goethe schiller and heine into serbian and some of his own poems into german
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: jovan grcic was born in the village of cerevic in the municipality of beocin in srem vojvodina serbia on the 15th of november 1846 the oldest of three children jovan djordje and katica of todor and ana grcki who were of mixed serbian and vlach origin
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: his father todor a merchant died young 1850 leaving his wife to raise the children
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: jovan was educated in serbian in cerevic german in petrovaradin novi sad segedin and pozun bratislava
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: in 1863 jovan grcki began his brief but sensational career as a lyric poet a career which was over by the time he was twenty nine
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: the first five years he wrote five books of verse and three short stories
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he began with ne boj mi se fear me not a poem which appeared in the literary periodical danica in 1863
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he was a regular contributor with translations from german from 1864 to 1867
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he left pozun in his seventeenth year
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: instead of proceeding to the university he went to visit his parents back home in cerevic
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: there he fell in love with the stunning young milena stefanovic and through her parents he became acquainted with physician and poet jovan jovanovic zmaj milan kujundzic-aberdar laza kostic antonije hadzic and other men of letters of the time
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: milena stefanovic died suddenly at the age of 16 1863 while jovan was away preparing for his medical studies in pozun
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: shocked and horrified by milena's sudden death he began seriously writing poems dedicating an entire cycle of poems to her memory
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he wrote from your name mileno i baptize myself milenko he would eventually change his surname grcki to grcic and add his first love's name to his
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: it was from then on that he was known as jovan grcic-milenko in 1867 he moved from pozun to vienna to continue his medical studies at the university of vienna's school of medicine
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: there he became seriously ill and had to drop out before graduating
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: in 1873 he returned to his native village of cerevic but his illness tuberculosis progressed so much so that abbot german jovanovic a friend of the family intervened and took jovan to beocin monastery where he could receive better care in the monastery clinic than at home
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he died in the beocin monastery in fruska gora on the 25th of may 1875 at the age of 29
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he was buried near the entrance of the monastery
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: the funeral was attended by his medical colleagues jovan jovanovic zmaj md ilija ognjenovic-abukazem md who became one of the founders of the serbian medical terminology and lazar stanojevic md
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: he is better known for his lyrical poetry than his prose however having left us only three but extremely well written short stories with fantastic elements which need to be looked at
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: they are u gostionici kod poluzvezde na imendanu santavog torbara matica 1868 sremska ruza matica 1868-1869 and zmijina kosuljica matica 1868
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: all three short stories were printed and distributed by the publishing house of matica srpska in novi sad under the supervision of antonije hadzic
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: analyzing the fantastic stories of jovan grcic-milenko with reference to nikolai gogol 1809-1852 and e t a hoffmann 1776-1822 one can find that there are some similar elements in their work
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: the similarity between gogol and grcic is not an essential one
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: it originates from the imperative of time and the political orientation of grcic milenko and especially from the use of similar sources folk fantastic and folk beliefs
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: all these similarities are easily noticed though it is impossible to determine how familiar grcic was with gogol's work
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: the similarities between grcic and hoffmann is more general
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: it cannot be seen at once but many components of the fantastic are common to both writers
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: these are the protagonists feeling being cut off from the others and being exceptional the feeling of foreboding and complete interaction between the plot the main hero and nature
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian

lines.value: these similarities are not found in single parts of stories as with gogol but throughout the narrative
lines.name: Serbo-Croatian
